Thankfully Fileen and Brianna stay in the same cabin, otherwise the ship would be one room short… which would mean you’d be the short being out. It would probably mean sleeping in the brig when no one is occupying it. But otherwise that’d mean having to share a room with someone… which could have unintended consequences. When that “completely disarmed” smoke grenade managed to start slowly leaking in your cabin and Irinda happily offered to let you room with her for a night… let’s just say you didn’t get a whole lot of sleep. Irinda has kept the offer open, which makes you extra careful not to leave anything too strange in your cabin.

Calling it a cabin might be a bit of a stretch, but at least it’s a private spot for you. Sure, it’s barely big enough for a bunk, but you are the lowest sentient being on the totem pole. Sarina’s spacious captain’s quarters on the other hand, you’d be willing to part with a significant bounty share for some time in that room. Not that Sarina lets anyone in there; someone might make a remark about the snuggly bear. But its ok, this cabin is all yours, free to sleep in the relaxing bed of Giglin soft fiber, molding to your form and cradling you into sleeping in far past time for chores. You’re sure no one will mind, it’s not like there’s been a lot going on lately.

You stretch lazily, and try to roll over. Unfortunately, something seems to be in your way, which is odd considering how little space there is for anything to get in the way. And you keep the cabin so Spartan. It feels… soft, and warm, and… gooey? Uh oh, Mindy. The goo girl has occasionally had the habit of crawling into bed with people. Maybe it’s the warmth? Mindy isn’t much of a talker. But she’s snuggled up close to you, her mostly humanoid form pressed against your bare back under the blanket. You also notice her ‘arms’ wrapped around your sides, although they seem to have lost some of their form, and her gelatinous limbs are now coating most of your sides, her fingers and hands now broad and flat and wrapping around most of your midsection. “Uh, Mindy, hey…” you mutter sleepily, trying to coax the strange alien off of you. You’re not even sure you can get out of bed with her like this.

Mindy makes some kind of cooing or purring noise, which you take as some form of acknowledgement. Although instead of, you know, scooting herself out of bed, she takes a different tactic. Her extended hands at your sides start to vibrate, her surface wriggling gently against your skin. The practical effect of this is extremely ticklish, and you immediately start to squirm in your bed. But her hands stick to you like glue, and continue to vibrate against the entirety of both your sides, from hip to lowest rib. “Ah! Ahaha! H-hey, Mindy, nohoho!” You protest, still groggy but quickly waking up now that the tickling is getting to you. “Ehehe, Mindy stahahap! I’m awahahahake!” You giggle, trying to convince the silly creature to lay off.

Unfortunately for you, Mindy seems to take “awake” to mean “you could tickle me even more if you want to!” Her form presses closer against your bare back, and now you feel that wriggly, vibrating feeling against the entirety of your back. While not the most ticklish spot, it definitely tickles, and all over your whole back at once! Now your really squirming in bed, bucking and kicking off the blanket in hysterical laughter. “Nyahahahaha! Mihihihindy-ehehehehehe! Pleehehehehehehase!” You plead with her through your laughter, as it feels like the goo girl is tickling you all over.

Just when you think you can’t take any more, Mindy suddenly stops her ticklish vibrations against you, and with a happy burbling sound lets you go. You collapse back onto the bed, and by the time you can turn around the good girl has dissolved her form and slipped under the frame of the door. As you lay there, still giggling, you wonder if someone sent her in as a wake up call, or if Mindy did that on her own. It was so hard to tell with Slithers.

Deciding now was good a time as any to get up, you stand in your little cabin and dress for the day. You put on a pair of skintight pants made of a grey Radin fabric that seems to keep you comfortable no matter what the temperature. You put on your boots, then grab your top. It’s a black Kichi garment that seems to perfectly accentuate your chest, if you do say so yourself. Admittedly, the small garment is sleeveless, and doesn’t go past your ribs, leaving everything from your waistline to lowest ribs exposed. But you were always more about mobility and freedom of movement than plenty of protection.

Then the communicator above your bed lights up, relaying an audio communication. “Ren! I know humans don’t need this much sleep! Get your lazy self over here, I need your help with something.” Realizing you have your first task of the day, you exit the cabin. Brushing your hair as you walk, you make your way over to-
133122.title: A ticklish wakeup call

choices: Irinda is in the middle of 'persuasion' when you get there
You arrive in the middle of an interesting discussion
The brig door opens on an unconscious Irinda- and no prisoner
1331223.content:
The Nighthawk’s not a massive ship and making it from the stern and the lowest deck to the bridge at the bow and top deck doesn’t take long for someone who spent half their life running from the law- and the fact that the captain requested you speeds things up too. About 40 seconds later the doors to the bridge slide open and you dart through, almost tripping but managing to recover and coming to a half-assed attempt at standing to attention.

The bridge is sort of split into two parts. The cockpit section, where Tim is currently sat is mostly reinforced sci-fi glass that you wouldn’t be able to name if your life depended on it. But it gives the pilot a wide field of vision if he ever flies into a section of space that actually has something worth looking at. This half is darkened, with monitors and screens covering the walls, though you’re certain some just display the same squiggly line over and over to make it look like an important reading. The middle of the space is taken up by a holographic display table, that projects images and data either on the tabletop itself or above as a hologram. Placing any sort of electronic device on top of it also allows ERin to access its contents and right now there’s some sort of cube sat in the middle of the table. And given the amount of red flashes the screen emits every few seconds that’s not going as intended right now.

Sarina who was leaning over the table snarls in anger and slams a furry paw down on the screen, causing part of it to flicker and turn a funny color for a moment. “Again!” She growls.

“I’m sorry Captain. I’ve tried everything I can and everything that, technically, I shouldn’t. It’s not working.” Being an artificial intelligence at no risk of being hurt, ERin's voice remains calm even as Sarina bares her teeth in another snarl. The same can’t be said for you as she turns her attention to you. To your relief however her face lightens slightly so you know you’re not here to be punished- which means you still have time to find those missing pictures and destroy them any way possible. Why you thought taking them was a good idea in the first place you’ll never know, but alcohol may’ve been involved.

“Ren.” She says in a calmer voice, but still not without an impatient undertone. She picks up the cube in one hand, making it look much smaller than it really is in her large claws and holds it out for you to take. “I’m sure you know what this is. Are you capable of opening it?”

Yes to the first, no to the second. From the intricately traced carvings on the golden surface of the cube, you recognize it as a precursor tesseract, like that one you stole from a museum back at Atheron spaceport. No one knows who made them or how long ago, but they hold vast amounts of data. You know that some hints of what’s inside can usually be found with the right software but without a passcode that’s theoretically- and so far literally- impossible to decipher they’re next to useless.

You tell that to Sarina who’s frustration only grows. “Typical- I hired the most useless thief in the galaxy.”

“What’s in this thing that’s so important anyway?” You ask as Sarina takes it back from you.

“The location of the crashed treasure vessel, Heart of Mirazon,” ERin tells you, displaying an image of what must be the ship she’s talking about. “It disappeared in an ion storm in the Etheral Nebula several decades ago carrying the personal fortune of Iona Kithariti, a kichi noblewoman. At least that is what I can glean from what little I have access to.”

“Any idea what the code is then?” You ask. “Or are we just cutting our loses and selling it?”

“Irinda is- doing her best.” Sarina tells you with a wolfish grin appearing on her face. “We acquired it in the last attack. Morgan tells me the previous owner was locking it when he walked in on her.” You remember hitting a lightly armed research ship a day or two ago. It wasn’t a great haul- mostly just papers and lab equipment that would fetch no price. Sarina must only just have realized the true value of this thing. There hadn’t been many people on board either- only one of them had failed to escape on some sort of warp-equipped escape pod. You guess that must be the poor sucker Irinda is hosting right now.

“Obviously she knows the access code, but so far she’s been un-cooperative.”

“Or she could’ve locked it without knowing how to unlock it.” You suggest.

“Perhaps. Either way I thought you might be able to provide an alternate solution. Seeing as you failed and I have nothing better for you to be doing before lunch, go help Irinda. I’m certain she’d love your company.”

You fidget awkwardly as you work desperately to find an excuse. But the captain knows you have nothing better to do and even if you did it was nothing short of a direct order.

“I’ll- go see if she needs a hand.” Reluctantly you turn to leave before turning back around. “By the way, is this a realistic kind’ve treasure hunt, or a legend of a legendary treasure of legends treasure hunt? Because the last o-“

“Ren.” Growls Sarina with clear intent.

“On my way.” You call over your shoulder as you leave the bridge as fast as you can.
1331223.title: Access denied

choices: You place your fingernails at Gora's wrists.
You grab a pair of Hili feathers.
You take one of Irinda's devices and point it at the prisoner.
13312231.content:
You resign yourself to helping Irinda. Not that she’s a bad person, in fact Irinda is a really nice person. She was friendly to you as soon as you joined the crew, the helped you figure out how to get the ship’s shower to work just the way you wanted it, she taught you how to use Erimosi chopsticks… but you’ve never met an Erimosi more interested in tickling any sentient being around her. And that’s saying something for an Erimosi. You suppose that’s why she’s in charge of the brig. You’ve noticed even Captain Sarina doesn’t get too close to Irinda if she can help it. You’re sure there’s a story there, but getting it out of Irinda would probably require spending some time in her cabin and sharing that Giglin rum you got on that last run… well, maybe some day.

But spending any time with Irinda inevitably gets you tickled. Sure, she taught you exactly how to get the shower temperature and pressure just the way you liked it, but it led to her joining you in there for a very wet and very one-sided tickle fight. And then there was the time you screwed up on that snatch and grab on Resha Prime and Sarina made you train with Irinda… it turns out Erimosi martial arts are way more effective than what you learned on the streets, and far more ticklish.

You make your way across the ship and down to the brig. As the doors open, you’re immediately met with the sound of laughter. Apparently Irinda is already hard at work. An X-frame is laid out horizontally in the center of the room, and laying on top of it is a green skinned Radin woman. Her jacket has been removed, leaving her wearing only a thin wrap around her breasts. A force field is keeping her still, and if it weren’t there you’re pretty sure the woman would be squirming off the table. Her eyes are squeezed shut and her teeth clenched as she tries unsuccessfully to stop snickering. Her antennae twitch erratically above a silver colored pixie cut hair. The Radin seems to be about your age, relatively speaking, as you notice some lingering dark-green freckling on her face and arms characteristic of Radin youth. Below the waist, the Radin woman is wearing tight black pants made of some kind of synthetic material you don’t recognize. Her footwear has been completely removed, and her bare feet are being attended to by Irinda.

Irinda is wearing even less than her prisoner, which doesn’t surprise you. Her top is a small garment that does no more than a passing job of covering her nipples and the undersides of her breasts but little more, the white fabric in stark contrast to her jet black skin. A pair of white short-shorts hug her hips tightly, and a matching pair of white boots cover her feet and ankles. Her snow white hair is pulled back in a human-style ponytail, and her eyes are focused intently on her prisoner. She’s sitting at the foot of the X-frame, and has a hand up to each of the prisoner’s feet, her nails gliding up and down the soles as she watches her captive intently. It takes a moment, but eventually Irinda notices you and looks up.

“Ren! Did you want to come play with the prisoner too?” Irinda asks, looking to be in a very good mood. “Or were you just looking to spend some time with me?” The Erimosi gives you a playful look, prompting you to quickly answer.

“Ah… Sarina wants the access code to the tesseract, and she’s getting impatient.” You tell Irinda. “So she sent me to lend a hand.”

“Impatient? That does sound like Sarina.” Irinda says thoughtfully, not seeming to care that the boss was in a bad mood. “That’s too bad though, I was hoping to drag this out for a while…” Her hands keep raking up and down the Radin’s soles, but she pauses for a moment to press a button on the control panel. Suddenly, the Radin’s laughter is muffled, almost inaudible, but you can tell she’s still laughing. “There, don’t want any interruptions! So far all I’ve gotten out of her is name, rank, and serial number. Her name is Gora, and she was a research assistant at that lab. Poor thing panicked and jammed up the warp drive on her escape pod. Lucky us, huh?

“I’ve been warming her up down here, but I have a hunch the best tickle spots are farther up. Take a seat, and let’s see what you can do! If you’re a good interrogation assistant, I might just have a reward for you…” Irinda said, making you wonder what exactly she had in mind by a reward. “Although if you need some pointers, I’m sure Sarina wouldn’t mind if I give you a training session in… techniques?” A shiver runs along your spine, as you don’t need to wonder at all to know what THAT means. You take a seat at the head of the X-frame, looking down at the poor Radin girl. She just ended up in the wrong place at the wrong time. Still, you need those access codes, and you definitely don’t want want to disappoint Sarina or Irinda.

Looking next to you, you notice a table of tools both simple and technologically complex. Then again, using your own fingers might be best medicine. You look down at your captive: her arms stretched up along either side of you, her armpits taut and exposed, and farther down a smooth belly also makes for a tempting target. How to start?
13312231.title: Irinda is in the middle of 'persuasion'

133122312.content:
You choose to grab some Hili feathers to get Gora’s smooth belly. While she was giving you tips, Irinda focused them on your own tummy, and you found them quite effective. You look down at the Erimosi, who presses a button to unmute Gora. “Well, well, well, Gora,” she begins. “We seem to have quite a predicament here. You see, my boss needs those access codes, and my assistant and I have ways of convincing you if you don’t tell me. So, do you want to give me those access codes, or do you need to be convinced?”

“I can’t tell you,” Gora states, although she does seem quite submissive.

“Well, I guess we’ll go for the convincing method, then,” Irinda resolves, nodding her head at you.

You take the two Hili feathers and begin to dance them on the sides of Gora’s midriff, while Irinda’s nails restart their trek across the bare soles of your captive. “AHAHAHAHA!” Gora bursts out in laughter at the first touch of the tools. “DOHOHOHOHONT! PLEHEHEHESE!”

“You know what you have to do for us to stop,” you announce. “Tell us the access code.”

“AHAHAHA NOHOHOHO!” Gora manages to laugh out the resistance as her body twitches violently in a squirming manner. Resolved to impress Irinda and Sarina, you move the feathers in towards the center of Gora’s abdomen, causing her laughter to jump quite a bit. “PLEHEHESE! NAHAHAHAT THEHEHEHERE!”

“Ooh, I think you found a good spot!” Irinda happily exclaims as she jumps up. “You get that bellybutton with the feathers. I’m going to help on the other side of our guest’s tummy.” You obey, placing one feather inside the navel and twirling the other in a circle around it, and Gora’s laughter goes off the scale. Meanwhile, the Erimosi takes one of her machines and places it on the right side of the ticklee’s stomach, covering up a thin line from her bellybutton to her side. She flips a switch on it, and the machine whirs to life. Irinda moves the machine up and down Gora’s midsection, and your victim’s twitching becomes even more violent, as well as her laughter, which is near silent. Following five minutes of this treatment, Irinda yells out above the hysterical laughter, “Alright, we can stop for now!” You take the feathers off of Gora, whose laughter continues and then becomes very hard breathing. “So, Gora, that was just a taste of what we can offer. Would you like us to do it again, or will you give us the access code instead?”
133122312.title: Hili Feathers.

choices: The tesseract opens! You have the right code
1331223121.content:
“The… access… code… is…” Gora’s hard breathing continues as she begins to give in to your demands.

“Hold on,” Irinda orders. “I’m going to need you to wait until you can speak coherently to give us the code. Also, I should let you know now that if that access code is wrong, you will be punished beyond your wildest imagination, so you better tell us the truth.”

Gora nods, then takes her time to catch her breath. Thirty seconds later, she proclaims, “I can give you the access code now.” She proceeds to give a lengthy access code, which Irinda writes down.

“Take this to Sarina,” Irinda commands you, handing you the paper. “I’m going to have fun with the prisoner while I wait for the results of this code.”

You nod, taking the code up to Sarina. “Well, Ren?” she says sternly. “Did you get the code?”

“I have a code, and the prisoner said that it works,” you declare. “However, Irinda is making sure she doesn’t get too rested while we test it.”

“Let’s get to it, then,” Sarina announces. “Read the code to Erin, and she’ll put it in.” You do so, and when you finish reading the code,
1331223121.title: Code Breaker

13312231211.content:
When ERin finishes putting in the code, the tesseract begins spinning, and it slowly opens up, leading ERin to proclaim, “I am downloading the information, captain. When I finish, where would you like me to show it?”

“Just back on the screen, ERin,” Sarina declares, satisfied. “Good work, Ren. You can go tell Irinda that we were successful. Also tell her to prepare the prisoner for slavery. We’re going to sell her to Kichi tickle slavers.”

“Yes, captain,” you affirm, returning to the brig. When you get down there, you motion for Irinda, who is still tickling Gora’s bare belly, to stop and come into the next room. “Irinda, we got the right code! ERin is getting the data from the tesseract as we speak.”

“Good,” Irinda cheers. “Did Sarina have an opinion of what to do with the prisoner?”

“She said we’re going to sell Gora to a Kichi tickle slaver,” you relay the information. “She wants you to prepare Gora for it.”

“Then I will,” Irinda confirms. “Now for you. You were a very good interrogation assistant today, managing to find Gora’s worst spots very quickly and exploit them. I promised you a reward if you could do that, and I intend to deliver. Your reward will be to tickle me on the interrogation table once Gora is off. You’ll get ten minutes, so I suggest you use them wisely. I can get Gora off the table and in her cell in fifteen minutes, and then I’ll teach you how to use the interrogation table. How does that sound?”

“Really good,” you state, excited to be the tickler instead of the ticklee for once. “While you’re dealing with Gora, I can go up and ask Sarina how long it will be before we sell her off.” Irinda nods, so you head back up to Sarina. “Sarina, Irinda is preparing the prisoner to be sold. She and I were wondering how long it would be before we get to sell off the prisoner.”

“We are on track to get to the Kichi tickle slaver in two hours,” Sarina notifies you. “She is waiting for us, so make sure Irinda gets her ready in time.”

“Will do, Captain,” you promise before heading back down to Irinda. The Erimosi interrogator has her captive in her arms, unconscious, as she prepares to carry her back to her cell. “We’ve got two hours before we’re supposed to sell her to the Kichi.”

“Alright, she’ll be ready when I cuff her and put her in her cell,” Irinda announces. “Pick up those cuffs for me, will you?” You do as she says, following her and Gora into the cell. “Here.” Irinda takes the cuffs, binding Gora’s wrists behind her back and her ankles together, and then finishes it off by tying the cuffs together with a rope by the cell. Lastly, she takes a pen that claims to have washable ink in it and puts a large ‘X’ on Gora’s belly. “The hogtie is to prevent her from escaping when she gets up, and the X marks the most ticklish spot. That’s so the tickle slaver doesn’t have to search to find the most ticklish spot. Many tickle slavers are happy when this is done.” She finishes up this thought, and then turns her attention to the other matter at hand. “But you probably don’t want to hear that much about selling Gora. You want your reward I promised you. Come with me.” You follow Irinda back to the interrogation table. “Some tools I think you might be interested in using. This is an electric brusher. You turn it on with the press of this button, and wherever the bottom hits will be tickled thoroughly. This is pretty effective on both the tummy and feet. Next up are the sole scrubbers. You put this strap around the front of the victim’s feet, then press this button. The machine will begin scrubbing the bare soles of the victim, and the sensation is very effective. Of course, you know about the Hili feathers and other standard tools like electric toothbrushes, regular brushes, feather dusters, and paintbrushes. I also have a ten-raspberry machine. You place this down on a victim’s stomach, and adjust the intensity, length of raspberry, and time between raspberries using these dials. When they are satisfactory, you just press this button, and the machine will start blowing ten raspberries at once. If Gora hadn’t given us the right code, this is what I would have used on her. I’m sure she would have given us the correct code quickly after that. Anyways, you can one of these, or you can always use your fingers. As far as the actual table, this is the switch to flip to restrain me. You can adjust between X, Y, T, or I position with this dial. If you want me completely restrained, turn on the force field with this switch, and I won’t be able to squirm at all. I think that’s all I can tell you for now but be sure to ask if you have any questions. The moment you start tickling is when the ten minutes start. I’ve already prepared the timer to record the start time and to automatically deactivate any machines you leave on at ten minutes. It will also beep loudly to let you know that the time is up so there is no question. To let me out, simply flip the switch to turn off the force field and then flip the restraining switch, and then I’ll be out. Do you have any questions?”

“No, I think I understand it,” you dictate, having followed the important steps fairly well. “Go ahead and get on.” Irinda does so, and you restrain her in an Y position, then turn on the force field. Once the Erimosi is fully in your control, you decide to start tickling…
13312231211.title: Unlocked Tesseract

133122312111.content:
You choose to start Irinda off with a few machines. “I think these sole scrubbers will work well on your feet, Irinda,” you announce, taking one of the machines and placing it on the Erimosi foot. Before long, you have added a second sole scrubber to the other foot. “And I believe that I’ve seen Mindy very effectively tickle your tummy before, so the raspberry machine should work well.” At this, you see Irinda’s face turn to a grimace, as if she was scared of what you were about to do. “Scared, Irinda? Just think of how bad it will be when I actually turn the machines on. You’re just to tickle-tickle-ticklish to take ut, aren’t you?” You set the raspberry machine down on her bare belly, and then you decide it is time to start tickling. “So, Irinda, I wonder what will happen if I switch these on?” With a smirk, you hover your hand near the on switch for the raspberry machine, then pretend like you won’t flip it, and when Irinda gets a hopeful look, you flip the switch.

“NOHOHOHOHO!” Irinda bursts into hysterical laughter. “HAHAHAHAHAHAHA!” Before long, her laughter increases when you turn on both the sole scrubbers. Observing her carefully, you realize that without the force field keeping her still, Irinda would be squirming out of control. Good. For all the time she’s tickled you, she deserves that… and more. You see your armpits, still exposed but safe from the tickling… for now. Before your time is up, you decide to tickle them with…
133122312111.title: Machines

1332.content:
Not to brag or anything, but there’s no firewall, software, or security system that’s stopped you yet. Bank security, ship AI- you name it you’ve hacked it. Most people think of pirates as being all brawn and no brain. But that’s not entirely true. And luckily for you they keep thinking that right up until the moment their shields and engines start powering down.

Of course Sarina was one of those people initially. Sure Yathi prefer displays of power, but it took a lot of convincing to get her onside. Two banks, a merchant transport and a military security-grid to be precise. You’re still not sure whether she’s entirely convinced, or if she still thinks you're a glorified mechanic but it doesn’t really matter to you…
1332.title: Digital piracy

choices: Ren bursts into your room. "Hide me!"
You hear two sets of laughter drifting in from outside
ERin comes onto comms- for your ears only
13321.content:
The sight of the lush jungle moon below makes a nice change from the usual black of space of late. Out of the window you can see rivers winding through endless forest, obscured only by the occasional patch of cloud. It kind’ve reminds you of your own homeworld, though you left that place behind and never looked back long ago. With the serene background music playing though it makes for a calming backdrop as you take a screwdriver to the remote hacking unit that you were trying to show Morgan how to use the other day- right before he dropped the damn thing into a glass of water. How he managed it you have no idea, but the clumsy oaf’s not getting anywhere near your equipment from now on. Fortunately all the parts that weren’t water-proofed were easily replaceable and you had spares for each of them. And after fitting the last piece into place and screwing the backing back on you can give yourself a pat on the back- and begin the long process of re-calibration.

Whoo.

It would be much easier if it weren’t so hot in here though. Irinda was tampering the air-conditioning not too long ago. Something about a practical joke. Now though, despite Flin, Raol and your best efforts the whole system’s stuck until you can make landfall again. But seeing as you’re laying low for a while that could be some time. For Tim and Fileen it's no problem- hell they probably prefer the thermostat being all the way up. But for everyone else it's unbearable at times. Which is why the upper part of your jumpsuit is currently hanging over your belt and the sleeves tied at the front, leaving your upper-body completely exposed save for a black bikini-top of nylonesque material. Naturally this made Irinda very happy, more so than the time Fileen forgot Brianna was still bound in her unlocked cabin and you wonder if that wasn't her plan all along. Fortunately, unlike other members of your crew, you don’t mind playing the ticklee. In fact it’s usually enjoyable. Good thing too otherwise your only other option would to be sweltering right about now. Well more than you are already anyway. As it is you feel soaked in sweat and loose strands of hair keep gluing themselves to your face. If your not careful you might have to re-water-proof the damned hacking unit.

Speaking of which, you’re just turning it back on when…
13321.title: The sweltering calm before the storm

choices: Let Ren hide in your closet (and make her pay you later)
Tickle Ren until Irinda comes to get her
133211.content:
Your door suddenly bursts open and Ren exclaims, “Hide me, Deena! I’m being chased.”

“Calm down, Ren,” you tell the panicked cabin girl. “Who is chasing you?”

“Who do you think?” she questions, still hyped up. “Irinda! She’ll tickle torture me if she finds me! You’ve got to hide me! Please, Deena!”

You quickly think about it. If Ren is trying to hide from Irinda and you hide her, you’re bound to get tickled for her location. You could just tickle Ren and leave her to Irinda when she arrives, and you’d be safe. However, Ren does get tickled quite a bit, and she doesn’t particularly like it. Come to think of it, it wouldn’t be too bad to go through another tickle session with Irinda. You eventually decide to…
133211.title: Panicked Ren

choices: Ren comes out before you can answer
1332111.content:
“Fine, Ren, get in the closet,” you allow. “I won’t tell Irinda that you’re here, but it’ll cost you.”

“Thanks so much, Deena,” Ren relaxes as she goes to your closet, closing the door naturally.

You refocus your attention on the hacking unit, finally getting the chance to turn it back on. Unsurprisingly, it finally works, so you go and place it into a waterproof containment unit to stay until you need it again. Right as you finish closing the containment unit, your door opens again. “Hey, Deena?” Irinda enters. “I’ve been looking to train with Ren. Have you seen her?”

Turning around, you lie, “No, I haven’t.”

“Really?” Irinda questions. “I saw her coming over to this part of the ship, and I’ve checked with everyone else. No one has seen her since I did.”

“Nope, I haven’t seen her,” you repeat your lie.

“I don’t think you’re telling the truth,” Irinda asserts as she comes closer to you. “I’ll rephrase the question. Where is Ren?”

“I don’t KNOHOHOHOHO!” you begin laughing as Irinda’s fingers contact your sides. “IHIHIHI DOHOHOHOHONT KNOHOHOHOHO!”

“You’re lying, Deena,” Irinda claims as her fingers make their way into your exposed armpits. “I can tell it. Come on, just tell me where Ren is.”

You refuse, trying to get away from her. “IHIHIHI DOHOHOHON’T KNOHOHOHOW! IHIHIHI SWEHEHEHEHEAR!”

Unconvinced, Irinda tickles you over to your bed. You get a respite when you fall back, but the interrogator jumps on top of you, grabbing your hands. She uses a convenient set of bonds on your bed to restrain both your wrists and your ankles. Once you have been tied up, Irinda looks back at you from the foot of your bed. “Well, well, well, I think we both know your best move, Deena. Either you tell me where Ren is or I tickle it out of you. What do you think?”
1332111.title: Hide Ren

choices: Give in and tell Irinda where Ren is
13321111.content:
“Irinda, I already told you that I don’t know where Ren is,” you assert once again.

“I was kind of hoping you’d say that, Deena,” Irinda announces with a smile on her face. A smile comes onto your face as she starts lightly wiggling her fingers over your soles. “Tickle, tickle, Deena! Tell me where Ren is or I’ll keep it up.”

“NOHOHOHO!” you giggle through the soft tickling. Following this, Irinda increases the intensity, enough to get you into full laughter. “AHAHAHAHA!”

After five minutes of tickling your soles, Irinda pauses. “Are you ready to talk now, Deena?”

“I… don’t… know… where… Ren… is,” you respond, trying to catch your breath.

“Well, I was really hoping not to have to do this,” Irinda proclaims, “but I guess if you don’t want to talk, I’ll have to tickle your tummy.”

This causes you to reconsider your answer, as your tummy is easily your most ticklish spot. With Irinda having plenty of experience tickling your midriff, you’re not sure if you want to get tickled that intensely again. As Irinda walks up to your stomach, you decide to…
13321111.title: Refuse to tell Irinda

choices: You tell her where Ren is to try and stop your tickle torture
133211112.content:
Even though your tummy is incredibly ticklish, you conclude that you need to keep your word and not give Ren up. Also, getting tickled is fun, isn’t it? “I’m kind of surprised you didn’t give her up by now, Deena,” Irinda admits as she places her fingers on your midriff. “I know how ticklish this is and how much you hate it getting tickled, but you deserve this and I can’t complain about getting to tickle it.”

“AHAHAHAHAHA!” you burst out in laughter as Irinda’s fingers begin moving across your bare belly. “NAHAHAHAT MYHYHYHY TUHUHUHUMEHEHEHE!”

“Tickle, tickle, Deena!” Irinda coos. “You know how to get me to stop. Just tell me where Ren is.”

“NOHOHOHO!” you ticklishly refuse. “IHIHIHI CAHAHANT! IHIHIHI DOHOHOHOHONT KNOHOHOHO! STAHAHAHAP IHIHIHIRIHIHIHINDAHAHA!”

However, the Erimosi continues to tickle torture your sensitive stomach, getting all the laughter that she can out of you. “Actually, at this point, I don’t really care if you tell me where Ren is. I’ll just tickle you instead.”

“STAHAHAP!” you yell in desperation as Irinda’s pointer finger hits your bellybutton. “NAHAHAHAT THEHEHEHERE!”

“Oh, I know how ticklish this bellybutton is, Deena,” Irinda teases. “It’s my favorite spot on you, so why should I stop?”

“PLEHEHESE, IHIHIHIRINDAHAHA!” you beg for mercy. As Irinda continues to tickle you,
133211112.title: Hyper-Ticklish Tummy

choices: “but I’ll let you go, since you helped me.”
“I think it’s time I got some revenge on you.”
1332111122.content:
One moment your bare belly was being tickle tortured and you were in a laughing fit, and the next, nothing is on you and you hear Irinda burst out laughing. Looking up, you see that Mindy has come into your room and is tickling Irinda’s bare belly, with the Erimosi helplessly squirming. Mindy quickly takes your former tickler to the ground, allowing Irinda to lay on top of her as the Slither tickles all over her midriff.

Hearing Irinda’s laughter, Ren peeks out from the closet, and when she sees what is going on, she comes out and goes straight to you. “Wow, you endured a lot of tickling,” Ren comments. “And all to protect me.” You look up at the cabin girl, seeing a happy gleam in her eyes. “You are still tied up, though. And that belly looks really ticklish. And you’ve tickled me a ton in the past.” With a sly smile, Ren continues…
1332111122.title: Slither Invasion

choices: Use her own tickle machines against her
13321111221.content:
“As much as I just want to tickle torture you for all the times you’ve gotten me, you really pulled through for me today, and I thank you for that,” Ren proclaims. “I’ll get my revenge on you later, but right now, let’s get some revenge on Irinda.”

“I totally agree with you,” you announce as Ren undoes your bonds, freeing you. Once you sit up, the two of you look down at the captive Erimosi, already nearly breathless from the tickling torture Mindy is giving her. “Let’s get her.” Soon enough, your fingers and Ren’s have joined Mindy’s goo on the bare black belly, and within a minute, Irinda’s laughter has turned silent. You stop everyone, as that is what Irinda would have done, to give a maximum torture effect to the helpless Erimosi. “Let’s take a break so she can get her breath back. That’s always what she does, and it seems much more torturous that way.”

Once Irinda gets her breath back, she pleads, “No more. Please. I can’t take it.”

“Looks like it’s time for her to laugh again,” you announce, and the six hands descend on the captive midriff.

“AHAHAHAHAHAHA!” Irinda gives up pleading, which she had done earlier, as the tickle torture began again. She tried to squirm away from the three of us, but Mindy held her fast while contributing a significant amount to the tickle torture. The three of you tickle Irinda to silent laughter three more times, each time taking a break to let the Erimosi interrogator regain her breath, and then…
13321111221.title: Mercy... for you

13321111222.content:
“I think it’s time I got some revenge on you,” Ren announces. “You always get to tickle me, and I never get to return the favor to you.”

“Come on, Ren, I just saved you from being tickled by Irinda,” you try to reason. “She would have tortured you, but she tortured me instead.”

“True,” Ren allows, “but I don’t get this chance very often.”

“NOHOHOHO STAHAHAP!” you laugh as Ren’s fingers dance across your bare belly. She quickly searches your sensitive stomach, easily finding that your bellybutton is your most ticklish spot. “NAHAHAHAT THEHEHEHEHERE!” She completely ignores your pleas for mercy, continuing to torment your midriff. After five minutes, which feels like a long tickle torture, Ren…
13321111222.title: Ren's Revenge

choices: Do you want to help me tickle Ren?
I saw Fileen tickling Brianna in her cabin, and she was looking for some help
1332112.content:
“Alright, Ren,” you appear to agree with the cabin girl as you get closer to her. “You can hide right here!”

Instead of showing her a place to hide, though, your fingers make contact with Ren’s bare belly. “NOHOHOHOHOHOHOHOHO!” she screams out, realizing your treachery in an instant. You quickly advantage of Ren’s vulnerability, grabbing her arms and pinning them over her head before pushing her onto your bed. Knowing that you have bondage on your bed, you secure Ren in a spread-eagle position before beginning to tickle her again, moving all over her bare belly. “PLEHEHEHEHEHEHEHEHESE DEHEHEHEHEHEHEHENAHAHA! LEHEHEHEHEHET MEHEHEHEHE OHOHOHOHOHOHOUT!”

“Oh, I will,” you promise, giving the naïve cabin girl a glimpse of hope before you continue, “as soon as Irinda gets here. I’m sure she can take you somewhere else that will be much more fun than my room.”

“NOHOHOHOHO DOHOHOHOHOHOHOHONT DOHOHOHOHOHOHO THAHAHAT!” Ren pleads, changing her original demands since she knows that Irinda would be much worse than you. “YUHUHUHUHUHUHUHU CAHAHAHAHAN TIHIHIHICKLEHEHE MEHEHEHEHEHE, BUHUHUHUHUT DOHOHOHONT LEHEHEHEHEHET IHIHIHIHIHIRIHIHIHINDAHAHAHA GEHEHEHEHET MEHEHEHEHEHEHE!”

“Umm, if I refuse Irinda, then I would just be joining you, so I don’t think so,” you state the obvious, preferring to sacrifice Ren over yourself to the tickle interrogator of the ship.

A few minutes later, you hear a knock on your door, and you beckon your visitor in. “I thought I heard a certain cabin girl laughing in here,” Irinda greets the two of you. “I was looking for Ren for a while, but she had appeared to disappear. So glad to know you found her, Deena. Is it alright if I take her for some tickling?”

“Of course, Irinda,” you immediately agree, giving Ren a devious smile.

“Oh, and Deena…” Irinda starts,
1332112.title: No Mercy for Ren

choices: Ren’s laughter reaches new levels as her bellybutton is tormented
You aimed the wrong way, and the tickle pen is tickling your bellybutton instead
13321121.content:
“Do you want to help me tickle Ren?” Irinda questions. “I don’t want you to give up on tickling her just because I’m tickling her.”

“No, no she doesn’t!” Ren insisted as Irinda let her off the bed and restrained her. “Deena doesn’t even like tickling me! She would much rather be MMF!” Tired of Ren’s protests, Irinda puts a hand over her mouth, preventing the cabin girl from trying to pass tickling onto you.

“Oh, I think I could try to enjoy it,” you refute Ren’s attempt at getting out of more tickling. “Any way I could have a crack at her upper body?”

“I don’t see anything wrong with that,” Irinda responds. “I wanted to tickle her there, but there’s plenty of Ren’s upper body to go around between the two of us.”

“Great, then I’ll help!” you announce, to Ren’s muffled protests. “Where to?”

“Well, I know it’s not exactly standard protocol, but I was thinking of testing out some of my new interrogation devices on Ren, so we’ll head to the brig,” Irinda proclaimed. “I think that will be a fun way to spend some time.”

“You bet,” you respond as you follow Irinda and Ren to the brig. The devious Erimosi binds spread-eagle Ren to a table, testing the ties out with a few tickles to the cabin girl’s bare belly. “So, where were those new interrogation devices you were talking about?” you ask once Ren is fully secured.

“I think you’ll like this one; it’s for her tummy,” Irinda answers as she gives you a small pen-like device. “Aim it at her bellybutton and press the button in the middle; it will shoot out an extremely powerful tickle laser to get her laughing. I’m going to go for her armpits; these armpit orbs switch what they feel like to tickle the armpits most effectively.” Irinda placed the armpit orbs in place, and very quickly after she flipped them on, Ren was in hysterics. Seeing the wonderful opportunity, you press the center button on the tickle pen, and…
13321121.title: Assisting Irinda

choices: She uses the machines on Ren and tickles you
She uses the machines on you and tickles Ren
133211212.content:
You realize very quickly that you have made a huge mistake, just before you burst out in laughter, “NOHOHOHOHOHOHO!” True to Irinda’s word, the tickle pen is shooting out a very powerful tickling laser; only, instead of tickling Ren’s bellybutton, it tickles yours. This is a major problem for you, as your bellybutton is undoubtedly your most ticklish spot, and this tickle pen is tickling it like mad.

Irinda quickly takes note of your situation, but more importantly, she realizes that the tickling will stop in a few seconds when you inevitably drop the pen. To avoid this and give herself a second ticklish victim, the Erimosi rushes over and grabs the tickle pen, pulling it closer to you and keeping it aimed at your bellybutton. You soon release the pen, but it doesn’t matter, as the laser continues to tickle torment your tickle button. “Oh, no, we can’t have you getting away that easy, Deena,” Irinda teases. “Since you made the mistake of tickling yourself with the tickle pen, you need to be taught a lesson, and that means you get tickled more! Tickle, tickle, tickle!”

“NOHOHOHOHO STAHAHAHAHAHAP!” you plead through your laughter, although you know it is pointless to beg Irinda for mercy. “PLEHEHEHEHEHEHESE!”

“I told you that I’m teaching you a lesson, and that means you get tickle-tickle-tickled more!” Irinda reprimands, grabbing your arms and forcing them over your head. “And now, I think you should get even more tickling! You and Ren will both be my tickle subjects for the day! Doesn’t that sound just amazing?”

“NOHOHOHOHOHOHOHOHO!” you flatly deny, still trying to wiggle your way out of the situation, although unsuccessfully. “LEHEHEHEHET MEHEHEHEHEHE GOHOHOHOHO!”

“I already told you I can’t do that,” Irinda refuses as she picks you up. She takes you over to another table, and suddenly, the tickle pen stops. Despite no longer being tickled, you do not have enough energy to resist anything, and Irinda easily restrains you to the table. “Well, Ren, I’m sorry for not paying any attention to you while I was getting Deena tied down here, but now, we can all have some fun. So you both know, I’m going to start by putting my machines on one of you, and the other will be treated to me tickling them personally. But the only question is who gets the machines and who gets me?”
133211212.title: Missed Target

choices: Tell the Captain and assemble to crew!
Go out on a daring solo operation!
Figure out a way to blast off from this stupid moon!
133213.content:
Just when you’re about to turn on the hacking unit, you hear a low hum reverberate in your ear. “Deena, there’s a problem.” You hear in a feminine voice that somehow manages to sound organic and metallic at the same time. ERin, speaking through the small communications device embedded in your ear. It’s a big help when you need her to speak to you covertly, although it’s a shame you’re not capable of the same. “We’re not alone on this jungle moon. And whoever else is out there has been attempting to hack my systems.”

Oh, that sounds bad. “What?!” You cry out in indignant surprise. The only reason Tim landed us here is because this hot humid mess of a moon is visited by spacecraft about as often as you get first dibs on the Yathi boar ribs. Which is to say almost never, Sarina is very particular about getting the best bits. And now not only is someone else here, but we didn’t know about it. Worse yet, they’re hacking us!

You take a deep, calming breath, and put the hacking device into your pocket. It probably works now anyway. You mostly fixed it. “ERin, what do you mean when you say that someone is hacking your systems? And why are you only telling me?”

“First, a shipwide communication might possibly be detected by the attackers.” ERin tells you, even more calmly than you can be in this situation. Or any situation, for that matter. “Also, an increasing amount of my resources are being dedicated to deflecting their efforts. Talking merely to you is easier.”

Well, that does make sense. “OK. So, what can you tell me about these hackers? Who are they, what methods are they using?” You ask, starting to get your mind in gear from hot summer nap time to important thinking time.

“As best I can determine, I am being probed by a precision ultra-modulating laser located approximately five kilometers south of our location. I am 74% certain it is of Giglin design, however I have no way of knowing if the users are Giglin themselves. I have implemented your Omicron Countermeasure sequence, per your programming. However, the laser is transmitting data faster than I can encrypt, and I estimate the intruders will grain full control of my systems within eight standard hours. I don’t need to remind you that all my systems will likely be turned against the crew at that point, and the odds of your success against me are…”

“Never tell me the odds, ERin.” You cut her off quickly. Not only does that sound bad, but someone is out-hacking you! It’s pretty galling, but that laser does sound like a pretty impressive piece of technology. If it could be mounted on the Nighthawk instead, think of all the damage you could do! But first things first, you need to save the ship. Time to...
133213.title: ERin comes onto comms- for your ears only

choices: "Fine. We use stealth." You, Ren, Tim and Irinda set out to stop the hackers
"I said find Morgan and the others."
1332131.content:
Eight hours. Yeah, that’s not a lot of time. Normally 5 kilometers would be no problem. But 5 kilometers through dense jungle and with who knows what out there? Problem.

You think quickly about what you might need, but in the end you only take a handful of items. The data tablet that straps onto your left wrist, a compact drone that fits into a pouch on your belt and a plasma edged knife that fits into a sheath on your boot. No need to take a radio- the comms device over your ear can keep you in contact with ERin and the rest of the crew- as well as listening in on whoever’s trying to take control of Erin if you can get close enough and get the right frequency.

Finally you load a magazine onto the top of your submag gun and make sure the power cells are fully charged. You sling the lightweight railgun over your shoulder and make your way out of your cabin headed for the bridge.

It stands to reason the only room in the ship that isn’t a damned sauna is the one the captain’s in. With the AC on full, despite the occasional worrying clunk, it’s almost too cold and the sweat quickly disappears from your exposed upper body. Sarina is alone and looking angrier than usual for reasons already known.

“Just the person.” She growls as you approach the display table in the back half of the bridge. “This damnable AI has-“

“ERin’s being hacked.” You say before the captain can tell you what’s wrong. You quickly fill her in on the details and she’s gracious enough not to interrupt you as you speak.

“The only good news is that the device they’re using needs a direct line of sight at the Nighthawk.” You say once you’ve finished explaining the situation. “Then we know that they’re south of us and how far away they are and-“ You pause as an idea materializes in your head that might be worth a try.

“ERin I know this might be a long shot.” You admit as you look at the unusually blank holographic tabletop. “But can you bring up a terrain scan of everything south of us and up to 6 kilometers away?” There’s a long pause and you note that the AI’s response is much slower than it would normally be. But then the display lights up with a 3D map of the area you requested. Whoever it is must be on high ground to be able to have a direct shot at the Nighthawk- unless they have an impossible window to your ship through 5 kilometers of jungle. And though there’s a lot of high ground on the map there’s only one hill, actually a very big hill, that the hackers could be on.

“Looks like that’s the place.” You say quickly downloading the map to your tablet before ERin closes it and focuses her attention back on defending against the cyber-attack.

“Good. Now we can make them pay for trying to take my ship.” Sarina growls. “Find Morgan. Fileen and Brianna too. Tell them to prepare for a fight and meet me in 10 minutes at-“

“Pardon me boss but-” You interrupt. It’s a mistake you immediately regret- the thought of the first mate being anywhere near the Giglin device worries you but now Sarina’s giving you a look that’s even more concerning. “Maybe we should try to sneak up on them instead. If we take them by surprise we can take their stuff instead of risking damaging it in a fight.” Sarina’s expression softens slightly as she considers your proposal. “And maybe they’ve got more stuff like it we can use or sell. Wouldn’t want to lose that.” You add trying to sweeten the deal.

With a grunt the captain finally comes to a decision.
1332131.title: Tech support to the bridge

choices: The plantlife becomes more of an obstacle than you realized...
You walk right into one of their traps!
You spot one of them, and they haven't noticed you yet!
13321311.content:
Sarina growls reluctantly, but finally nods human-style to you. “Fine. Stealth it is. Take Ren, Tim and Irinda with you. And don’t make me regret this.” That last line made a shiver run down your spine. Assuming everyone makes it out of this in one piece, the last thing you want is to be on the wrong side of Sarina. Last time she made you re-wire the comm encryption unit with a Yathi obedience-band wrapped around your midriff and set to ‘high-random.’

“Alright guys, you heard the boss.” you tell the three. “Time, get your laser gun in case we get into a fight. But the goal is to NOT use it if possible.” Tim nods with a grin, and while you trust the Kichi you know he’s been itching to use the thing for a while now. “Irinda, grab whatever gear you need, and meet us outside the airlock in five minutes.” Irinda just smiles impishly and goes to her cabin. You don’t even know all the tools she has, but you know each and every one is very effective at something. She might be the most important member of this little infiltration team. “And Ren…” You turn to the cabin girl, who looks back at you expectantly. “Get the stunner and your binoculars.”

“Stunner?!” Ren complaints indignantly. “What about the X-ray Rifle? Or the mini-fusion grenades? Or even the Radin tickle-net?”

“Because you're a terrible shot, Ren.” You tell the young human woman. “And the last time you tried to use the tickle net you ended up wrapping yourself in it, remember?” Ren cringes, and its an incident she doesn’t want brought up. It’s not that Ren is useless, far from it. But her talents involve sneaking in and out, not weaponry and high-tech gadgets. That last part is where you come in. Ren wanders off to get the stunner and you move to your cabin to grab your own tools.

Trusting Tim to watch your back (and underarms, and belly…), you focus on grabbing your hacking gear. Let’s see, if it’s a Giglin device, you’ll definitely need scrambler… and the hacking unit that’s probably fixed (no time to test it now!)... and a couple other things that might come in handy. With your belt loaded to bear with high tech wizardry, you head outside the airlock, into the jungle outside. You’re immediately greeted by even hotter weather than in the ship. “Oh man… who’d want to spend any time out here…” You mutter, deciding to keep your suit open.

“Actually, I rather like it.” Tim says, slithering out of the ship with his trusty laser in hand. “My people would enjoy this place, which means our opponents might be Kichi…” Irinda and Ren follow close behind, ready to move out.

“I don’t think so, Tim.” You tell him. “I’ve never known Kichi to use Giglin tech. You guys are too proud of your own stuff. But we won’t now until we get there, right?” And with that, you move out. It’s not easy going, with the vegetation clustering thickly around you, vines and ferns obscuring any path. On the plus side, the enemy won’t see you coming. But that also means they could be five feet in front of you and you wouldn’t realize it either. And it’s uphill the whole way, too…

You’re just about to complain about the situation to your teammates, smug and comfortable Tim aside, when...
13321311.title: Fine. We use stealth.

choices: Until the local wildlife shows up
On the other side of the clearing Tim and Irinda await your command
133213113.content:
You’re accustomed to picking out things that don’t belong. Lines of code that shouldn’t be where they are. Wires that don’t quite blend in with the rest. Transactions on an activity log that don’t quite add up to the end total. And because of your honed skill you notice the sheen of green painted metal through the leaves in what little light reaches the ground- a single artificial entity in an otherwise natural environment.

The presence of something peculiar immediately puts you on alert. Without any unnecessary sudden movements or sound you motion for the rest of your team to get down. Luckily they’re all sensible enough to do so immediately and as stealthily as possible. For the next few minutes you watch, wait and listen. But strain as you might you hear nothing but the wind in the leaves and that irritating call of- whatever that lizard-bird-thing you saw earlier was.

You’re about to creep up to the metallic object, to make sure it’s not just an odd plant and you aren’t jumping to conclusions when you hear it. Unmistakably a sentient voice coming from somewhere up ahead. Then another. And another. In their short exchange you manage to pick out five individuals and you think you can pinpoint roughly where they are- it’s more difficult to tell with all these plants in the way.

Ok- time to find out who these people are and what they’re trying to do- besides hack into the Nighthawk and take control obviously. In hushed whispers you quickly come up with a plan of attack. As Tim and Irinda sneak around to the right, you take Ren with you left- more to keep an eye on the girl than anything else. She means well and she’s all enthusiasm but luck rarely seems to be on her side.

You pass the metallic object- some sort of now empty container- and advance slowly and carefully. By your reckoning you still have an hour or two before ERin’s defenses are defeated. You can still afford to take things carefully. Or as carefully as you can whilst heat and humidity sap at your concentration. Luckily for the four of you none of them seem to be keeping an eye out. In fact it’s almost like they’re not even bothering to stay undetected- you’ve been underestimated so much it hurts.

They’re all so focused looking inward that you manage to creep right to the edge of the clearing they’ve set up in. Three Giglin like you suspected. Annoyingly Tim was right- there’s a Kichi over there. And it’s the one actually operating the laser device- which is doubly annoying. But you put any thought of what his stupid face is going to say aside because all your attention is now on the hacking module.

You recognize it instantly- a GLX437. Military-grade, top of the line, cutting-edge tech that’s honestly making you feel uncomfortable down in your nether regions. It’s not that big or physically impressive- a tripod, a gray tube and a touch screen data-pad that clips to the back or can be used to remotely-control the device. Point that baby at any computer ever, flick the switch and it’d be decrypted in moments, giving you full remote access. It’s a testament to ERin’s endurance and tenacity that she’s managed to last hours.

And you’ll be sure to tell her as much when you bring it back on board.

And with that thought in your mind, you finally turn your attention to the fifth member of their group. A red-skinned humanoid who’s skin seems more soaked than yours. Then you note the five long tentacles growing out of the back of her head where hair would be on a human and the long slender fingers that curl and writhe like tendrils- that’s not sweat, its slime. She’s a pentaclid- native to a world that’s mostly water. She shows no sign of discomfort though as her slender form slinks toward the kichi manning the laser. You feel a shiver run down your spine as you envision what damage those tentacle like appendages must do to bare skin before steeling yourself for a fight.

That laser is as good as yours.
133213113.title: Eyes on the prize

choices: The Giglin starts to interrogate you
You speak up, trying to stall
1332131131.content:
You turn and look at Ren in surprise. The odds of meeting someone familiar in a galaxy this populated were literally astronomical. Plus Ren was the youngest member of the crew, and hadn’t exactly been planet hopping before joining the Nighthawk. “What?” you hiss at her, as quietly as you can. “What do you mean? Do you know any of them?”

Ren nods, and points towards one of the three Giglin, the shorter one with black hair. “That one, Ezmi. I… uh… may have stolen her credit chip and spent as much as I could before she noticed.” The former pickpocket and street thief looks a bit bashful, but proud at the same time, replying in a low whisper. “She was trying to chat me up at a sketchy bar back at Alpha Cen. Thought she could have whatever she wanted just because she was a Giglin showing up in that backwater. Maybe she has a human fetish, I don’t know. I am pretty hot…” Ren boasts shamelessly, an impish grin on her face. “But I was more interested in her wallet. She didn’t notice until the next morning, and by then I’d bought…”

Your young shipmate doesn’t finish that thought, as there seems to be some kind of commotion with the alien crew. Another one of the Giglin gesticulates about her, but you can’t make out what she’s saying. The Kichi and the Pentaclid look around them at the surrounding jungle, prompting you to duck lower and keep yourself fully in the brush. You silently will everyone to stay calm, since it doesn’t look like they’ve spotted any of you. They might be worried about something else completely. But then you turn to your left and… “Crap, they see us!” Ren exclaims, doing the exact opposite of what you wanted, raising her stunner.

“Wait, Ren!” you try to say to her, but before you can she’s fired off a shot into the group. And missed all of them. You never should’ve given Ren a weapon. Five aliens quickly turn in your direction, raising their own weapons. You’re completely outgunned, especially when you consider that a four armed Giglin can hold a lot of them. Not that it mattered, as the Pentaclid raised some kind of device up in the air. It must have been some kind of area of effect stunner pointed in the general direction of you and Ren, because you instantly felt yourself becoming very sleepy…

***

You feel yourself coming to, although you can’t quite open your eyes yet. You can feel yourself suspending upright in a force field, your wrists crossed over your head. You’re in a comfortable position, but you definitely can’t move to save your life. Which you hope isn’t the actual situation. You can hear two feminine voices talking nearby, and you can start to make out the words.

“...human computer and two captive humans. Maybe it’s just a whole ship of them!” One voice muses, sounding oddly enthusiastic about the idea. You didn't sneak on board the Nighthawk by choice or fancy. The piratical crew of the Nighthawk stole a mystical crystal belonging to none other than the incredibly wealthy and power-hungry Lady of Proxima, Katherine Corden, and as the last remaining member of the crew whose ship it was being transported on, you know your life depends on you getting the gem back. The Lady of Proxima abides no cowards, turncoats, or deserters in her employ.

The circumstances that brought about your hiding on board the Nighthawk are quite convoluted and somewhat ignominious. You joined Lady Katherine's private navy as a technician on a transport craft, it paid the bills and you didn't have to worry about killing anyone or anything messy. Despite the simple task of bringing Lady Katherine her recently uncovered crystal, your idiot crewmates thought it would be profitable to break from schedule and chase down the old clunker when they spotted it nearby on the scanner. Despite your cries that it was probably a pirate ship itself, they took one look at it's rust and age and decided it would be a good target for some profitable privateering in the name of the Lady. Nobody cared to listen to a lowly mechanic like you while they readied the magnetic clamps and boarding hatch.

It was when you saw the name Nighthawk painted on the side through a viewport that you knew you were in trouble. The fight was over in a matter of minutes: the meanest and stupidest of your fellow 'mates were gunned down quickly after attempting to attack the green Radin and the blonde human. The captain surrendered and handed over the giant glowing gem much to the happy surprise of the Nighthawk's crew, then made a beeline to the escape pods with the surviving crewmembers. You slipped down one of the side passages and hid in the Nighthawk's cargo hold after making sure there was nobody following you.

You suppose you had to become a stowaway: once the Lady finds out her precious cargo had been pinched, she will without a doubt hunt down the escape pods and punish your crew in some unspeakable way. Probably by having them enslaved and sold to an Erimosi tickle-slavery cartel, or perhaps kept alive writhing in a vat of torturous featherfluid for a decade or two. As you lay crouching behind an empty storage crate, you've realized your only option if you want to keep your life or sanity from the Lady's wrath is to find the strange crystal aboard the ship, steal it back from the famous pirates aboard, and deliver it to your mistress.

Maybe the captain has it, or maybe it's hidden in some onboard stockpile. Up to you to find out.
